  1 <?php
  2 
  3 namespace UserFrosting;
  4 
  5 /**
  6  * The UserFrosting application class, which extends the basic Slim application.  
  7  *
  8  * @package UserFrosting
  9  * @author Alex Weissman
 10  * @link http://www.userfrosting.com/
 11  * @property \Fortress\MessageTranslator $translator
 12  * @property \Fortress\MessageStream $alerts
 13  * @property \UserFrosting\SiteSettings $site
 14  * @property \UserFrosting\User $user
 15  * @property \UserFrosting\PageSchema $schema
 16  * @property \UserFrosting\JqueryValidationAdapter $jsValidator
 17  */
 18 class UserFrosting extends \Slim\Slim {
 19     
 20     /**
 21      * Sets up a guest environment, before we can authenticate a real user
 22      */
 23     public function setupGuestEnvironment(){
 24         //error_log("Current user id is guest");
 25         $this->user = new User([], $this->config('user_id_guest')); 
 26         $this->setupServices($this->site->default_locale);
 27         $this->setupErrorHandling();
 28     }
 29         
 30     /**
 31      * Sets up the environment for the current logged-in user, along with translation and error-handlers
 32      */    
 33     public function setupAuthenticatedEnvironment(){
 34         //error_log("Setting up authenticated user environment");
 35         $this->setupServices($this->user->locale);
 36         $this->setupTwigUserVariables();
 37     }
 38     
 39     /**
 40      * Sets up key UserFrosting services: message stream, translator, and client-side validation adapter
 41      */    
 42     public function setupServices($locale){
 43         //error_log("Setting up message stream");
 44         /**** Message Stream Setup ****/
 45         
 46         /* Set up persistent message stream for alerts.  Do not use Slim's, it sucks. */
 47         if (!isset($_SESSION['userfrosting']['alerts']))
 48             $_SESSION['userfrosting']['alerts'] = new \Fortress\MessageStream();
 49         
 50         $this->alerts = $_SESSION['userfrosting']['alerts'];
 51         
 52         /**** Translation setup ****/
 53         $this->translator = new \Fortress\MessageTranslator();
 54         
 55         /* Set the translation path and default language path. */
 56         $this->translator->setTranslationTable($this->config("locales.path") . "/" . $locale . ".php");
 57         $this->translator->setDefaultTable($this->config("locales.path") . "/en_US.php");
 58         \Fortress\MessageStream::setTranslator($this->translator);
 59         
 60         // Once we have the translator, we can set up the client-side validation adapter too
 61         $this->jsValidator = new \Fortress\JqueryValidationAdapter($this->translator);        
 62     }
 63     
 64     /**
 65      * Sets up error-handling routines.
 66      *
 67      * UserFrosting uses Slim's custom error handler to log the error trace in the PHP error log, and then generates a client-side alert (SERVER_ERROR).
 68      * It can also take specific actions for certain types of exceptions, such as those thrown from middleware.
 69      */
 70     public function setupErrorHandling(){
 71         /**** Error Handling Setup ****/
 72         // Custom error-handler: send a generic message to the client, but put the specific error info in the error log.
 73         // A Slim application uses its built-in error handler if its debug setting is true; otherwise, it uses the custom error handler.
 74         //error_log("Registering error handler");
 75         $this->error(function (\Exception $e) {
 76             if ($e instanceof AuthExpiredException) {
 77                 $controller = new AccountController($this);
 78                 return $controller->logout(true);
 79             }
 80             
 81             if ($e instanceof AccountInvalidException) {
 82                 $controller = new AccountController($this);
 83                 return $controller->logout(false);
 84             }
 85             
 86             if ($e instanceof AuthCompromisedException) {
 87                 $controller = new AccountController($this);
 88                 return $controller->pageAccountCompromised();
 89             }
 90             
 91             if ($e instanceof \PDOException) {
 92                 // Log this error
 93                 error_log("Error in " . $e->getFile() . " on line " . $e->getLine() . ": " . $e->getMessage());
 94                 error_log($e->getTraceAsString());
 95 
 96                 // In case the error is because someone is trying to reinstall with new db info while still logged in, log them out
 97                 session_destroy();
 98                 $controller = new AccountController($this);
 99                 return $controller->pageDatabaseError();
100             }
101             
102             if ($this->alerts && is_object($this->alerts) && $this->translator)
103                 $this->alerts->addMessageTranslated("danger", "SERVER_ERROR");
104             error_log("Error in " . $e->getFile() . " on line " . $e->getLine() . ": " . $e->getMessage());
105             error_log($e->getTraceAsString());
106         });
107         
108         // Also handle fatal errors
109         register_shutdown_function( [$this, "fatalHandler"] );     
110     }
111     
112     /**
113      * Set Twig global variables for the current user, either as a logged in user or a guest user.
114      */
115     public function setupTwigUserVariables(){
116         //error_log("Setting Twig user variables");
117         $twig = $this->view()->getEnvironment();  
118         
119         // If a user is logged in, add the user object as a global Twig variable
120         if ($this->user)
121             $twig->addGlobal("user", $this->user);
122         
123         // Set path to user's theme, prioritizing over any other themes.
124         $loader = $twig->getLoader();
125         $loader->prependPath($this->config('themes.path') . "/" . $this->user->getTheme());           
126     }
127     
128     /**
129      * Sets up the Twig environment and custom functions
130      */
131     public function setupTwig(){
132         //error_log("Setting up twig environment");
133         /* Import UserFrosting variables as global Twig variables */    
134         $twig = $this->view()->getEnvironment();   
135         $twig->addGlobal("site", $this->site);
136         
137         // Set path to default theme, overwriting any other paths that have been added at this point.
138         $loader = $twig->getLoader();
139         $loader->setPaths($this->config('themes.path') . "/" . $this->site->default_theme); 
140         
141         // Add Twig function for checking permissions during dynamic menu rendering
142         $function_check_access = new \Twig_SimpleFunction('checkAccess', function ($hook, $params = []) {
143             return $this->user->checkAccess($hook, $params);
144         });
145         
146         $twig->addFunction($function_check_access);    
147         
148         // Add Twig function for translating message hooks
149         $function_translate = new \Twig_SimpleFunction('translate', function ($hook, $params = []) {
150             return $this->translator->translate($hook, $params);
151         });
152         
153         $twig->addFunction($function_translate);
154 
155         // Add Twig function for fetching alerts
156         $function_alerts = new \Twig_SimpleFunction('getAlerts', function ($clear = true) {
157             if ($clear)
158                 return $this->alerts->getAndClearMessages();
159             else
160                 return $this->alerts->messages();
161         });
162         
163         $twig->addFunction($function_alerts);
164         
165         // Add Twig functions for including CSS and JS scripts from schema
166         $function_include_css = new \Twig_SimpleFunction('includeCSS', function ($group_name = "common") {
167             // Return array of CSS includes
168             return $this->schema->getCSSIncludes($group_name, $this->site->minify_css);
169         });
170         
171         $twig->addFunction($function_include_css);
172         
173         $function_include_bottom_js = new \Twig_SimpleFunction('includeJSBottom', function ($group_name = "common") {    
174             // Return array of JS includes
175             return $this->schema->getJSBottomIncludes($group_name, $this->site->minify_js);
176         });
177         
178         $twig->addFunction($function_include_bottom_js);
179         
180         $function_include_top_js = new \Twig_SimpleFunction('includeJSTop', function ($group_name = "common") {    
181             // Return array of JS includes
182             return $this->schema->getJSTopIncludes($group_name, $this->site->minify_js);
183         });
184         
185         $twig->addFunction($function_include_top_js);
186         
187         /* TODO: enable Twig caching?
188         $view = $app->view();
189         $view->parserOptions = array(
190             'debug' => true,
191             'cache' => dirname(__FILE__) . '/cache'
192         );
193         */
194     }
195     
196     /**
197      * Set up the fatal error handler, so that we get a clean error message and alert instead of a WSOD.
198      */     
199     public function fatalHandler() {
200         $error = error_get_last();
201       
202         // Handle fatal errors
203         if( $error !== NULL && $error['type'] == E_ERROR) {
204             $errno   = $error["type"];
205             $errfile = $error["file"];
206             $errline = $error["line"];
207             $errstr  = $error["message"];
208             // Inform the client of a fatal error
209             if ($this->alerts && is_object($this->alerts) && $this->translator)
210                 $this->alerts->addMessageTranslated("danger", "SERVER_ERROR");
211             error_log("Fatal error ($errno) in $errfile on line $errline: $errstr");
212             header("HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error");
213             exit();
214         }
215     }
216 
217 }
